00002 #define __SCHEDULING_H

00007 //Merc scheduling actions
00008 //NOTE:  Any modifications to this enumeration also require updating the text in EditorMercs.c used
00009 //                 in the editor for merc schedule purposes.
00010 enum
00011 {
00012       SCHEDULE_ACTION_NONE,
00013       SCHEDULE_ACTION_LOCKDOOR,
00014       SCHEDULE_ACTION_UNLOCKDOOR,
00015       SCHEDULE_ACTION_OPENDOOR,
00016       SCHEDULE_ACTION_CLOSEDOOR,
00017       SCHEDULE_ACTION_GRIDNO,
00018       SCHEDULE_ACTION_LEAVESECTOR,
00019       SCHEDULE_ACTION_ENTERSECTOR,
00020       SCHEDULE_ACTION_STAYINSECTOR,
00021       SCHEDULE_ACTION_SLEEP,
00022       SCHEDULE_ACTION_WAKE,
00023       NUM_SCHEDULE_ACTIONS
00024 };
00025 
00026 #define SCHEDULE_FLAGS_VARIANCE1                            0x0001
00027 #define SCHEDULE_FLAGS_VARIANCE2                            0x0002
00028 #define SCHEDULE_FLAGS_VARIANCE3                            0x0004
00029 #define SCHEDULE_FLAGS_VARIANCE4                            0x0008
00030 #define SCHEDULE_FLAGS_ACTIVE1                                    0x0010
00031 #define SCHEDULE_FLAGS_ACTIVE2                                    0x0020
00032 #define SCHEDULE_FLAGS_ACTIVE3                                    0x0040
00033 #define SCHEDULE_FLAGS_ACTIVE4                                    0x0080
00034 #define SCHEDULE_FLAGS_TEMPORARY                            0x0100      //for default schedules -- not saved.
00035 #define SCHEDULE_FLAGS_SLEEP_CONVERTED          0x0200      //converted (needs to be uncoverted before saving)
00036 #define SCHEDULE_FLAGS_NPC_SLEEPING                   0x0400      //if processing a sleep command, this flag will be set.
00037                                                                                                                                                       
00038 // combo flag for turning active flags off
00039 #define SCHEDULE_FLAGS_ACTIVE_ALL         0x00F0
00040 
00041 #define MAX_SCHEDULE_ACTIONS 4
00042 
00043 typedef struct SCHEDULENODE
00044 {
00045       struct SCHEDULENODE *next;
00046       UINT16 usTime[MAX_SCHEDULE_ACTIONS];      //converted to minutes 12:30PM would be 12*60 + 30 = 750
00047       UINT16 usData1[MAX_SCHEDULE_ACTIONS]; //typically the gridno, but depends on the action
00048       UINT16 usData2[MAX_SCHEDULE_ACTIONS]; //secondary information, not used by most actions
00049       UINT8 ubAction[MAX_SCHEDULE_ACTIONS];
00050       UINT8 ubScheduleID;
00051       UINT8 ubSoldierID;
00052       UINT16 usFlags;
00053 }SCHEDULENODE;
00054 
00055 extern UINT8                        gubScheduleID;
00056 extern SCHEDULENODE *gpScheduleList;
00057

00062 void DestroyAllSchedules();

00072 BOOLEAN SaveSchedules( HWFILE hFile );

00075 void PostDefaultSchedule( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier );
00076 void PostNextSchedule( SOLDIERTYPE *pSoldier );
00077

00079 //we then need to post the events and process schedules for the time that we have been gone.
00080 void PostSchedules();
00081 
00082 //Sorts the schedule in chronological order.  Returns TRUE if any sorting took place.
00083 BOOLEAN SortSchedule( SCHEDULENODE *pSchedule );
00084 //Adds a schedule to the list.  COPIES THE DATA OVER (ALLOCATES NEW NODE!)
00085 void CopyScheduleToList( SCHEDULENODE *pSchedule, SOLDIERINITNODE *pNode );
00086 //Entering the editor automatically removes all events posted.
00087 void PrepareSchedulesForEditorEntry();
00088 //Leaving the editor and entering the game posts the events.
00089 void PrepareSchedulesForEditorExit();

00091 //before saving the map, as this forces the IDs to align with the SOLDIERINITNODE->ubScheduleID's.
00092 void OptimizeSchedules();
